results.title: Australian Fibreboard Container
results.brief_description: A film commissioned by the Australian Fibreboard Manufacturers Association and APM to develop and promote cardboard box use. Depicts the logging of eucalypts, log processing, pulping and drying of paper, as well as paper recycling, cardboard processing, different tests for strength and the role of cardboard in packaging.

results.title: Australian environment: South West Australia
results.brief_description: From ancient times the south east corner of the continent has been isolated by seas on one side and the arid inland plains on the other. Many strange plants and animals have survived in this area and evolved striking characteristics. This film is a brief visit to this living museum of natural wonders found in the south west of Australia.

results.title: Australian dream
results.brief_description: Dorothy Stubbs is married to Queensland’s “Butcher of the Year”, Geoff Stubbs who is campaigning to be Prosperity Party Candidate for suburban Avon Heights. But Dorothy finds something missing in her life, especially when she attends a Sex Aids party and starts to fantasise about the male stripper there- Todd, (also horse-riding instructor, rock singer and petty thief). When Geoff invites the leader of the Prosperity Party to the monthly neighbourhood b-b-q at his house (with the theme “Come as Your Favourite Fantasy”) and Dorothy secretly invites Todd’s band, the dreams of both are destined to collide in an hilarious night of drunkenness and debauchery. Cast: Noni Hazlehurst, Graeme Blundell, John Jarratt, Barry Rugless.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 136
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Four generations: Golden Jubilee of War Veteran’s Homes; four generations of ex-servicemen have benefited from this service. Camp Southern Cross: International camp is one of the activities held throughout the world to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee Of Guiding. Held at Britannia Park, in the Dandenongs, Vic. January 1970. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 135
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Coleambally irrigation area, N.S.W.: Water has brought good production and harvests to farms which were once barren wildernesses; Albert Park: Five hundred and seventy acres of Melbourne parkland are put to good use; a large lake, parklands, sporting areas, buildings and a restaurant. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 134
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Bush Hostel: the dingo-proof fence which runs along the border of New South Wales, Queensland and South Australia is patrolled and repaired. The Todd family live on the job and the three children have been taught by correspondence but are now able to attend school for the first time. Tea and Sugar Train: Fifty maintenance camps are scattered along the Trans Continental Railway which runs along the Nullabor Plain. Weekly trains bring essential supplies and news to families at these lonely outposts. No other credits available.
